{'headline': 'Queer in Appalachia', 'abstract': 'Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.', 'web_url': 'https://www.nytimes.com/2022/04/26/style/tiny-modern-love-stories-queer-in-appalachia.html', 'keywords': [{'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Love (Emotion)', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Modern Love (Times Column)', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Dating and Relationships', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}], 'pub_date': '20220426', 'text': 'In my Appalachian family, love tastes like apples. Each teenage woman goes through a family tradition: mastering a signature apple-based recipe to feed her future husband. (There are a lot of apples in Ashe County, N.C.) My great-grandmother made tarts; my grandmother, pies; my sister, cakes and strudel. My cooking fails were not so laudable. I burned dozens of desserts before I came out as gay. Fortunately, my family accepts me, and we still cook together. Being queer in Appalachia can be sour, but also sweet. {'headline': 'We Sent Love Through Our Thumbs', 'abstract': 'Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.', 'web_url': 'https://www.nytimes.com/2022/04/19/style/tiny-modern-love-stories-we-sent-love-through-our-thumbs.html', 'keywords': [{'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Love (Emotion)', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Modern Love (Times Column)', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Dating and Relationships', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}], 'pub_date': '20220419', 'text': 'In late 2020, I got very sick. After many months, specialists and dollars, there is still only a guess: long-haul Covid. I couldn’t breathe properly. An alien lived inside me. I was single, scared. What if something happened to me? My friend asked me daily for my “thumb status,” even though he hates texting because he says his thumbs are too big. On rare good days, I sent photos with a thumbs up. More were neutral thumbs. Most were thumbs down. Pain. Fatigue. Fear. Every day he asked. Every day I answered. Every day we sent love through our thumbs. — Emily O. {'headline': 'We Never Asked; He Never Explained', 'abstract': 'Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.', 'web_url': 'https://www.nytimes.com/2022/04/12/style/tiny-modern-love-stories-we-never-asked-he-never-explained.html', 'keywords': [{'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Love (Emotion)', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Modern Love (Times Column)', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Dating and Relationships', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}], 'pub_date': '20220412', 'text': 'I inherited nostalgia from my father. On weekends in Brooklyn, he would play his 78 rpm Ansonia records, drink beer and look forlorn. He’d lose himself in lyrics about “los jíbaros de las montañas,” the noble farmers of the mountains. Humility and dreams would float through the air while my sisters and I rolled our eyes; we couldn’t relate to music about Puerto Rico’s countryside. Once, I came home to my father sitting on the sofa, his records strewn about, cracked into pieces. We never asked; he never explained. The fissures remain. I long to hear those songs. — Sonia Pérez', 'concrete': None, 'weights': {'This Beach in Mexico Is an L.G.B.T.Q. Haven. {'headline': 'I Quietly, Foolishly Eloped', 'abstract': 'Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.', 'web_url': 'https://www.nytimes.com/2022/04/05/style/tiny-modern-love-stories-i-quietly-foolishly-eloped.html', 'keywords': [{'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Love (Emotion)', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Modern Love (Times Column)', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Dating and Relationships', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}], 'pub_date': '20220405', 'text': 'When I was 20, I quietly, foolishly eloped. At 22, I saw a cute boy in the corner of a college Bible study, his hat pulled low over his glasses. I was still — unhappily, secretly — married, but I flirted with the boy. He was polite, nothing more. By 23, I had divorced, escaping a miserable future. I rediscovered my faith and the joy of a close friend group, including the boy in the hat. I flirted, feeling awkward. Then one night, while watching a movie, the boy put his arm around me. It’s been there for 15 years. — Jess Locke', 'concrete': None, 'weights': {'The U.N. {'headline': 'Our Most Mundane Conversations Became Contentious', 'abstract': 'Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.', 'web_url': 'https://www.nytimes.com/2022/03/29/style/tiny-modern-love-stories-our-most-mundane-conversations-became-contentious.html', 'keywords': [{'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Love (Emotion)', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Modern Love (Times Column)', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Dating and Relationships', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}], 'pub_date': '20220329', 'text': 'Long before her diagnosis, my reliably cheerful friend turned sour. Even our most mundane conversations became contentious. Pessimism and frustration darkened her world. Eventually, as words eluded her and her thinking grew disorganized, the diagnosis came: early dementia. Terrifying, yes, but naming her condition set her free. Her joy returned in force. Now, when I visit her in her assisted-living apartment, a smile lights her face. Complex sentences are out of her reach. Instead, she pours out pure love — telling me I’m wonderful, beautiful and smart. Her son says her happiness lasts for hours after our visits. — Elise Gibson', 'concrete': None, 'weights': {'Coronavirus deaths in the U.S. fall to their lowest point since the summer.': {'A Vow to {'headline': 'The Empty City Was Our Playground', 'abstract': 'Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.', 'web_url': 'https://www.nytimes.com/2022/03/22/style/tiny-modern-love-stories-the-empty-city-was-our-playground.html', 'keywords': [{'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Love (Emotion)', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Modern Love (Times Column)', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Dating and Relationships', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}], 'pub_date': '20220322', 'text': 'Our schedules were opposite: office and restaurant. But then the world shut down, and the dining rooms were closed. When Aiesha would normally be waiting tables, we were riding our bikes through Little Rock’s empty downtown. Logging off from my remote work felt like hearing a school bell ring. The empty city was our playground. I remember riding our bikes along the Arkansas River in the dark with a huge smile on my face. It was the best kind of smile, unseen and electric. Somehow, I knew happiness within a tragedy. I found my best friend. — Kim Mai Draheim', 'concrete': None, 'weights': {'In Warsaw, a Network of Support Greets Those Crossing the Polish Border': {'1972: Millions of Workers Strike in Italy': 31, {'headline': 'It’s Hard to Tell Family About Sex, Love or Money', 'abstract': 'Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.', 'web_url': 'https://www.nytimes.com/2022/03/15/style/tiny-modern-love-stories-its-hard-to-tell-family-about-sex-love-or-money.html', 'keywords': [{'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Love (Emotion)', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Modern Love (Times Column)', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Dating and Relationships', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}], 'pub_date': '20220315', 'text': 'I met Andy the first day of college. He was the funniest, strongest and most outgoing person at school. The kind of guy an only child like me would want as a brother. He rushed into my room after Thanksgiving break, produced a notepad scribbled with boxes and arrows and said, “I told my mom about you. We’re related!” (My grandfather’s first cousin had married Andy’s great-aunt.) It’s hard to tell family about sex, love or money, so I tell Andy — as a friend. It’s hard to tell a friend you love him, so I tell Andy — as family. — Matthew Morchower', 'concrete': None, 'weights': {'On a trip shrouded in secrecy, 3 European leaders travel to Kyiv to offer {'headline': 'I Really Didn’t Want to Hurt Her', 'abstract': 'Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.', 'web_url': 'https://www.nytimes.com/2022/03/08/style/tiny-modern-love-stories-i-really-didnt-want-to-hurt-her.html', 'keywords': [{'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Love (Emotion)', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Modern Love (Times Column)', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Dating and Relationships', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}], 'pub_date': '20220308', 'text': 'The day after an ill-fated second date, I called my little brother as I lay in bed, despondent, in my dingy college apartment. “I don’t have time to come home and do laundry today,” I said. “Oh, and I met someone.” My brother, Felix, listened quietly to my inventory of hesitations: She liked me more than I liked her. She wanted commitment. She lived around the block, and I really didn’t want to hurt her. A pause. My brother said, “You have time for one load. I’ll come get you.” His pragmatic, gentle love is just right. — Ione Madsen Hardy', 'concrete': None, 'weights': {'How Maori Stepped In to Save a Towering Tree Crucial to Their Identity': {'Moldovans Welcome Fleeing Ukrainians, but Some Pack Their Own Bags, Too': 86, 'For this border crisis, Poles extend a warm welcome, unlike last time.': 73, 'Biden bans U.S. imports of Russian oil and natural gas, and Britain vows to phase Russian oil out.': 59, 'Battlefield reports are murky, but signs of Ukraine’s successes emerge.': 47, 'Moderna opens the door to enforcing its vaccine patents in some countries.': 43, 'W.H.O. condemns attacks on health care services in Ukraine and calls for safe passage for medical supplies.': 41, 'U.N. {'headline': 'So Fragile I Had to Look Away', 'abstract': 'Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.', 'web_url': 'https://www.nytimes.com/2022/03/01/style/tiny-modern-love-stories-so-fragile-i-had-to-look-away.html', 'keywords': [{'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Love (Emotion)', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Modern Love (Times Column)', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Dating and Relationships', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}], 'pub_date': '20220301', 'text': 'Ambivalent and heartbroken, I broke up with Jeff, my first love, as he entered medical school. We had known each other since we were 13 and 14. Post-split, we kept in touch. When my father died, Jeff showed up. When my mother needed a cardiologist, he treated her. Eventually something scary turned up on my own test. “Bring me the echo,” he said, referring to an echocardiogram. I sat beside him, watching a video of my heart pumping. It seemed so fragile I had to look away. “Normal aging,” he assured me. {'headline': 'He Was My Mother’s Type, Not Mine', 'abstract': 'Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.', 'web_url': 'https://www.nytimes.com/2022/02/22/style/tiny-modern-love-stories-he-was-my-mothers-type-not-mine.html', 'keywords': [{'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Love (Emotion)', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Modern Love (Times Column)', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Dating and Relationships', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}], 'pub_date': '20220222', 'text': '“I want to set you up with someone,” my mother said. I was immediately suspicious. “A friend’s son?” I asked. She paused, then said, “I did a bad thing.” To my horror, she created a JDate account, impersonating me. “I just wanted to find you someone to run with,” she said. Curiosity won: “My” profile was cringe-worthy, but the runner who wanted to meet “me” wasn’t so bad. After I confessed to my mother’s misdeeds, we met. He was my mother’s type, not mine. I rewrote my profile. The next guy made me laugh. We’ve been running together since 2002. — Rebeca Robboy', 'concrete': None, 'weights': {'Putin Calls Ukrainian Statehood a Fiction.
